Description: Red siltware pottery bowl with flat base, flaring sides and rounded lip, the whole is covered with a burnished red slip, worn in parts. On the interior, this slip was decorated with polishing in a spiral design. The fabric contains sand, grit and a small quantity of chaff. The rim is damaged and there has been exfoliation of the exterior surface, probably owing to salt action.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.100, p.190, pl.32, p.216, pl.58)
